DOWNLOADABLE PDF -- OVERRIDES ----- */\n/* ----- CAMPAIGN REPORT -- DOWNLOADABLE PDF -- OVERRIDES ----- */\n/* ----- CAMPAIGN REPORT -- DOWNLOADABLE PDF -- OVERRIDES ----- */\n/* ----- CAMPAIGN REPORT -- DOWNLOADABLE PDF -- OVERRIDES ----- */\n/* ----- CAMPAIGN REPORT -- DOWNLOADABLE PDF -- OVERRIDES ----- */\n/* How does this work? */\n/* MAKE_ME_A_PDF_YO  :  \n        The page's content needs to be wrapped in the \"make_me_a_pdf_yo\" div. \n        This allows all of the below styles to start overriding some stuff. */\n/* PDF_SLIDE  :  \n        The slide content itself is divided up into .pdf_slide divs. \n        This splits the content up the way that I want. \n        And it's completely ignored if the page isn't wrapped as a PDF with the make_me_a_pdf_yo div. \n        The pdf_slide wrapper also allows us to override some styles that prevent the content from fitting nicely. */\n/* PDF_DIV_REMOVAL  :\n        This class can be applied to any block of content that we want to hide completely. \n        It turns it to display None. */\n/* PDF_SLIDE_TITLE  :\n        I use this instead of our normal slide title. \n        It's formatted more for the PDFs.
